data.question: What is the empirical formula of CUST-736?
What method was used to measure the proton conductivity of CUST-736 and CUST-736a?
What change in proton conductivity is observed when DMA molecules are removed from CUST-736 to form CUST-736a at 80 °C and 98% RH?
data.answer: The proton conductivity of CUST-736a is about two orders of magnitude higher compared to that of CUST-736.

data.question: Is the proton conductivity of CUST-736a higher than CUST-736 at 80 °C and 98% RH?
What is the activation energy for the proton diffusion of CUST-736?
Does the removal of DMA molecules from CUST-736 to form CUST-736a involve a solvent exchange process?
What is the maximum proton conductivity of CUST-736a at 80 °C and 98% RH?
What mechanism governs the proton diffusion in CUST-736 and CUST-736a?
What is the role of water molecules in the proton conduction process of CUST-736 and CUST-736a?
data.answer: Water molecules play a critical role in the proton conduction process, and free water molecules may be more conducive to proton transfer than guest DMA molecules.

data.question: Is the proton conductivity of CUST-736a similar to those of other reported MOFs?
What temperature and relative humidity conditions were used to measure the maximum proton conductivity of CUST-736 and CUST-736a?
What structural feature of CUST-736 allows for the existence of DMA molecules within its channels?
data.answer: CUST-736 exhibits 3D frameworks with one-dimensional regular channels where DMA molecules exist stably through hydrogen bonding with the amide group of TPBTC and sulfonic acid group of 2-H2stp.

data.question: Does the removal of DMA molecules from CUST-736 result in an increase in proton conductivity?
What is the activation energy for the proton diffusion of CUST-736a?
What is the significance of the activation energy values obtained for CUST-736 and CUST-736a?
data.answer: The activation energy values suggest that the proton diffusions of CUST-736 and CUST-736a are governed by the vehicle mechanism, indicating the movement of free and absorbed water molecules within the pores for long-range proton transport.

data.question: Is the crystallinity of CUST-736 retained even when exposed to different relative humidities for 3 hours?
What is the yield percentage of CUST-736 synthesis?
What is the role of DMA molecules in the channels of CUST-736 according to the study?
data.answer: DMA molecules in the channels of CUST-736 are interconnected with the amide group of TPBTC and sulfonic acid group of 2-H2stp through hydrogen bonding, which may have negative impacts on proton transfer.

data.question: Does the study suggest that guest water molecules are more conducive to proton transfer than guest DMA molecules in MOFs?
What is the crystal system and space group of CUST-736?
